item.description:
This Hike is FULL

RSVP's are Closed

 

Before signing up for this event, please read and understand the entire Write-Up and the Liability Waiver. By signing up for this event you agree to the terms of the Liability Waiver.

Rating: Moderate

Distance: 6.5 Miles

Time Duration: 4 Hours

Blaze Orange: Recommended

The hike begins on the Escoheag Trail which is the white blazed path and is a 3 1/4 mile loop that wanders through a rocky forest. We will follow this trail to where it intersects with the blue blazed North South Trail which we will take briefly to the Falls River. Just before the bridge on the left side of the road is the start of the Ben Utter Trail. This trail is blazed in the blue of the North South Trail as well as yellow, which we will follow to where it splits and we will continue to follow the yellow blazed trail along the river. Soon we will veer off on the white blazed trail which will take us to the Stepstone Falls. At Falls River Road we will reverse direction and head back on the woods road, blue blazed trail to our intersection with the Escoheag Trail where we will return to our cars.

The Hike is about 6.5 Miles and should take 4 Hours to complete.

Bring Drinking water (1 Liter), Snacks, Hiking Boots and bug spray.

Address: 216 Escoheag Hill Road, Exeter, RI

Directions: Route 95 exit 5A, take RI 102 South to RI 3 South. Follow RI South to RI 165 West ( Ten Rod Road ). Follow RI 165 West 5 1/4 miles and take a Right onto Escoheag Hill Road and after about 1 mile you will see a grassy area with a Red Cabin on your Right. This is where we park. Note: Escoheag Hill Road is across from Woody Hill Road on RI 165.

Liability Waiver
